title: Velocity Build Troubleshooting
content: Build failures in Velocity are logged in the build console. Common causes: missing dependencies, syntax errors, test failures, and resource limits exceeded. To debug: check the build log, verify Dockerfile/buildspec.yml, ensure artifact storage is accessible. Retry with 'Clean Build' to clear cached layers.

title: Velocity Deployment Guide
content: Deployments in Velocity follow the pipeline stages: Build > Test > Stage > Production. Stuck deployments are usually caused by: approval gates, environment unavailability, or rollback triggers. Check the deployment timeline in Pipeline > Deployments. Manual intervention may require the DEPLOYER role.

title: Velocity Pipeline Configuration
content: Pipelines are defined in velocity.yml in your repository root. Key sections: stages, jobs, artifacts, and triggers. Pipeline errors often stem from: YAML syntax issues, invalid stage references, or missing secrets. Use the Pipeline Editor in Velocity UI for validation before committing changes.

title: Velocity Environment Management
content: Environments in Velocity are configured in Settings > Environments. Each environment has: variables, secrets, and deployment targets. Environment configuration issues include: missing variables, expired secrets, and incorrect target URLs. Use the environment diff tool to compare configurations across environments.

title: Velocity Agent Management
content: Build agents run your pipeline jobs. Agent offline issues are caused by: network problems, expired agent tokens, or agent VM restarts. To reconnect: regenerate agent token in Settings > Agents, restart the agent service. Self-hosted agents require manual maintenance; consider using Velocity Cloud agents for reliability.
